messages.content: Since I first stood for election I have never taken a single vote for granted. I have worked hard over the last seven years to keep my pledge to be a strong local voice for North Tyneside in Parliament and to do all I can to make life better for everyone who lives here, whether helping to bring 2,000 jobs to the Tyne or helping an individual with their tax query.

issues.brexitEurope: We are facing tough times ahead as the next government will have to negotiate our country's exit from the EU. If re-elected, my priority will be to ensure the best deal for the people of North Tyneside from the forthcoming negotiations.
issues.education: I have always cared about our schools. Recently, I have been actively opposing the unfair cuts the Government is imposing on all our schools.
issues.health: I have lobbied many ministers directly, via questions and in debates on issues including the pasty tax, the Independent Living Fund and Economic Funding.

housing.content: I have backed the work of our Elected Mayor, Norma Redfearn, and North Tyneside Council, by playing my part in the regeneration of North Tyneside.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have always cared about North Tyneside as a resident, as a councillor in Battle Hill for 15 years and in my role as MP. I was born here and most of my family live here, so everything that happens in North Tyneside affects me deeply.
